Author: JollyTrades
Title: TeleX AI | buying and selling crypto is now as easy as chatting with a friend
Body: @gslgroup,  Thank you for bringing the questions here.   > And how much do you want to raise for creation of this "simple chat bot"?  TeleX AI is going to be the easiest and simplest way to get access to cryptocurrencies and to use them, but it doesn't mean that this is a "simple chat bot;" indeed, it is more complex than the exchanges such as Coinbase, Kraken, etc. because it involves an artificial intelligence module and it is fetching liquidity from many other exchanges. As for the question, the hardcap of the ICO is $3mm.   > If you claim to provide services for free, than give some examples to whom and how. Show your real project to community. Otherwise, it is only words.  We do not claim to provide services for free. Please refer to the whitepaper.   > When will be signature campaign, how many messages per week and which sections are excluded?  Please refer to the Bounty thread.   > Where is the guarantee that bot will give impartial forecast which will bring a profit for a trader?  There is no such guarantee. The bot will NOT give forecasts. The bot will allow people to buy, sell and use cryptocurrencies.

Author: JollyTrades
Title: TeleX AI | buying and selling crypto is now as easy as chatting with a friend
Body: Hi,  Here's an answer I gave in relation to a similar question:  Our token sale employs an example of what I call revenue tokenization. Without the tokens, the revenue of TeleX AI would be in BTC, ETH and other cryptocurrencies in which the users pay a fee. We abstracted our revenue and tokenized it, thus it made us available to accept â€˜pre-orders.â€™ With cryptocurrencies involved, our example is complex. As a clearer example, think of a carpenter who wants to open her shop to make and sell wooden boxes but who lacks the capital to attain the means of production. She then takes pre-orders; in other words, she sells the boxes before she makes them. To do this, in exchange for the money she receives, she gives the creditors a token with which they can redeem boxes later. The tokens, in this case, is just like in-store currencies or casino chips. Our case is no different than that; we will provide services and accept TLX as payment, and we are selling TLX before they are actually usable â€“ thus, a presale.  How TLX differs from in-store currencies is that in-store currencies are just one way of payment, whereas TLX will be the only way of payment. How TLX differs from casino chips is that the issuer of casino chips has practically an unlimited supply of chips, so it is not expected for casino chips to rise in price, whereas the total supply of TLX is limited, so it may have a floating price, thereby opening the gates for speculative operations.  Click for the full interview: https://www.fxempire.com/news/article/interview-with-can-soysal-telex-ai-451953  Apart from this, I believe TeleX AI will be a friend in many people's contact list whether or not they use the bot for trading or as a wallet. Maybe they will just want to see how it works; or maybe they'll use it to track coin prices. And the fact that the bot is able to send direct messages to many crypto-related people's Telegram, Facebook and WeChat accounts can be monetized in various ways.

Author: The Crypto Peasant
Title: TeleX AI | buying and selling crypto is now as easy as chatting with a friend
Body: Great idea and a ever growing community.  How will it operate within telegram and what securties will you put in place to ensure funds are safe

Author: JollyTrades
Title: TeleX AI | buying and selling crypto is now as easy as chatting with a friend
Body: Dear followers,  Please have a look at the updated whitepaper: https://telexai.com/docs/TeleX_AI_wp.pdf      Thank you for your interest! The funds will be pooled and distributed in several wallets, hot and cold. Some of the funds will be stored in exchanges such as Bitfinex, and the highest possible account security measures will be taken. The entry points to the servers which hold the keys to withdraw funds from the pooled wallets will be severely restricted to eliminate any possible attack vector; those servers will communicate with a number of allowed IPs and no one else (site-to-site IPSec VPN with level 5 encryption). OSSEC and WAF will be used to provide maximum security. There are other security measures we are planning to implement, but I believe the wisest way would be to keep them for ourselves.

Author: JollyTrades
Title: TeleX AI | buying and selling crypto is now as easy as chatting with a friend
Body: Although we are a big fan and a proponent of the open source movement, unfortunately this project may not free its codebase because of commercial reasons - nonetheless we are committed to make the development as community-driven as possible. Think of this like Bitfinex, for example; no one has access to source code so it's not free software per se, but after all the offered services are good for nothing but the cryptocurrency ecosystem which I believe has now become an indispensible part of the open source movement in general.

Author: JollyTrades
Title: TeleX AI | buying and selling crypto is now as easy as chatting with a friend
Body: New exchanges suffer from lack of liquidity, hence their prices may diverge from the fair price at the market. I believe that's the thing you refer as "the problem," and it is actually something that we have a solution for. If you read the whitepaper, you will see that the Liquidity Engine has connections with outer exchanges. One of its functions is to check market prices and get the deal done for TeleX AI users at the best possible price. It means that we will fetch liquidity from largest exchanges to provide TeleX AI users with enough volume.
